moves.1. e4 d5 2. exd5 Nf6 3. Nc3 e6 4. dxe6 B: Kind of naive from white's side, unless he purposedly wants to keep his B away from his Kside.
moves.5... c6 6. Ba4 Bc5: Bd6 is more in the defence's mainline. But it is rare I can play this and delay d4, so I wanted to try it.
moves.7. d3: Good for me. I should have gone Ng5 at once.
moves.7... O-O: Anainst my principles, I castled "normally". This is not what I use to play, but the R's pressure on e8 on the white K, still a little away from castling, was too tempting. Good, old schemes work too!
moves.8. Qf3: Not a strong move, and I should have punished it with Bg5 at once.
moves.8... Re8 9. Nge2 Bg4 10. Qf4: I couldn't see a serious Q trapping, so I went elsewhere.
moves.10... Qb6: Pressing on f2, and even letting him castle. But I saw no way o break in at once.
moves.13... Bb4+ 14. Bd2 Nd5 15. Bxd5: Chooses to lose the B pair... My isolated central pawn won't be such a terrible weak point to defend.
moves.15... Bxd2+ 16. Kxd2: The good recapture, to connect rooks and keep a defence on the central squares. Otherwise, cxb and Qxb2 is a serious threat.
moves.16... cxd5 17. b3: I still can't go Qb4+ because QxQ doesn't give me anything.
moves.17... Nc6 18. Nc3 Nb4: Very well placed N of mine...
moves.19. Rhe1: ...and this aims for a hatefully drawn game... unless...
moves.19... Re6: I force RxR, otherwise Rf6 will be very strong on f2.
moves.20. Rxe6 fxe6: ! leaving a dangerously weak pawn on e6, but an f column ready for my R to grab.
moves.22. Qg4: Planning a revenge on e6, but my Q guards it...
moves.22... Rxf2+: My Q would have been more vulnerable to Re2.
moves.23. Kc1: ? Kd1 provided some more resistance at least.
moves.23... Rxc2+ 24. Kb1 Rxc3: Threats are multiple, and if White goes Qxe6+, after the exchanges black is clearly winning.
moves.25. Rxe6: This move would be a serious threat, if not for... Rxb3+, Kf1, Qc5+, Kd2, Rb2+, etc., or...
moves.26. Kb2 Rc2+: My opp resigned here. Of course...
moves.27. Ka3 Ra2#: ...is a very elegant mate. Thanks for reading, comments are welcomed!
